metadata.Title: CVE-2016-6128 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The gdImageCropThreshold function in gd_crop.c in the GD Graphics Library (aka libgd) before 2.2.3, as used in PHP before 7.0.9, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (application crash) via an invalid color index.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-6128` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libgd-tools - 2.1.0-3ubuntu0.2
libgd3 - 2.1.0-3ubuntu0.2
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> php uses the system libgd2 introduced in 2.1.0

criterions.comment: libgd2 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.1.0-3ubuntu0.2').
